intro: Psephellus meskheticus, commonly known as the Meskheti psephellus, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in mountainous areas and has adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
